name: Circuito Mágico del Agua
description: A spectacular evening display of 13 illuminated fountains with music and interactive water tunnels—the world’s largest fountain complex.

name: Parque del Amor
description: Ocean‑front mosaic park known for its romantic sculpture “El Beso” and sunset views, perfect for couples and photography.

name: Huaca Pucllana
description: Pre‑Inca adobe pyramid in the heart of Miraflores, with guided tours, on‑site museum, native flora and night illumination.

name: Larcomar
description: Cliff‑side shopping mall with ocean views, restaurants, cinemas, night-life, and boutique shops—a milestone of modern Lima.

name: Museo Larco
description: Archaeological museum displaying 5,000 years of pre‑Columbian art, ceramics and erotic artifacts—housed in a vice‑royal mansion.

name: Parque Kennedy
description: Central Miraflores park known for its friendly cats, artisan markets, street performances and local social atmosphere.

name: Puente de los Suspiros
address: Av. Paseo de la Republica 872, Barranco
description: Iconic wooden pedestrian bridge in bohemian Barranco—legend says couples make a wish while holding their breath crossing it.

name: Museo Pedro de Osma
description: Art museum in a beautiful Barranco mansion showing colonial art, sculptures and gardens—a peaceful cultural retreat.
